xxl.core.functions
Interface Binding<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the values to be bound.
All Known Implementing Classes:
BindingPredicate, Subquery
public interface Binding<T>

This class represent an object with free variables which can bind with values (arguments). This object can be a function, a predicate or a whole subquery.

Method Summary
 void restoreBinds()
          Set free all bound arguments.
 void setBind(int constIndex, T constArgument)
          Set a constant value to which a free argument should be bound.

          Set the constant values to which a part of the free arguments should be bound.
 void setBinds(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> constIndices, java.util.List<? extends T> constArguments)
          Set the constant values to which a part of the free arguments should be bound.

Set the constant values to which a part of the free arguments should be bound.

setBinds

void setBinds(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> constIndices,
              java.util.List<? extends T> constArguments)
Set the constant values to which a part of the free arguments should be bound.

Parameters:
constIndices - the indices of the arguments which should be bound to given arguments. The important is that it should always be sorted.
constArguments - the constant values to which a part of the free arguments should be bound.

setBind

void setBind(int constIndex,
             T constArgument)
Set a constant value to which a free argument should be bound.

Parameters:
constIndex - the index of the arguments which should be bound to the given argument.
constArgument - the constant value to which a free argument should be bound.

Set free all bound arguments.
